courseDescription: This course focuses on the fundamental elements of the Chinese language within a cultural context. Emphasis is placed on building a foundation of basic listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. The course includes Chinese Pinyin phonetic system, character formation, basic sentence structures, and Chinese culture and cultural activities. Students are expected to comprehend and respond to essential topics in Chinese and demonstrate their cultural awareness.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Comprehension of essential topics in Chinese

courseDescription: This course continues to focus on the fundamental elements of the Chinese language within a cultural context. Emphasis is placed on the development of basic listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. The course includes Chinese basic sentence patterns and real-life topics on Chinese cultural activities. Students are expected to comprehend and respond with grammatical accuracy to spoken and simple written Chinese and demonstrate their cultural awareness.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Demonstrating cultural awareness in Chinese context
Responding with grammatical accuracy in Chinese

courseDescription: Study of selected topics designed to permit small groups of qualified students to work on subjects of mutual interest.

courseTitle: Advanced Chinese Language and Culture I
courseDescription: This course takes students to an advanced level of communicative competence and language social interaction. The course includes more complex sentence patterns and Chinese cultural activities. Students learn to respond to topics of interest to college-age students, such as campus life, career planning, and Chinese cultural traditions. Students are exposed to the speech of native speakers in real cultural situations and develop sensitivity to communicative strategies and cultural competency.

courseTitle: Advanced Chinese Language and Culture II
courseDescription: This course takes students to a higher level of communicative competence and language social interaction. The course gradually introduces more formal speech and written-style language in the real cultural context. The course trains students to interpret textual and cultural meanings and to express their opinions and cultural understanding by using connected paragraph length discourse.
Technical and Digital Skills: Formal speech and written-style language proficiency
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Interpretation of written-style language in cultural context

courseDescription: Selected topics, genres, authors and/or literary, cultural, sociopolitical, or historical movements in the Chinese-speaking world. May be repeated for credit if the topic is different.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of historical movements in Chinese-speaking world
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of literary genres in Chinese
Historical analysis of sociopolitical movements in Chinese-speaking world

courseDescription: Seminars engage students in in-depth study of a specified topic through readings, research and oral and written student reports. Special attention is paid to theoretical and bibliographic issues. Topics vary according to the areas of expertise and professional interests of departmental faculty. May be repeated if topics are different.
Technical and Digital Skills: Reading and writing in Chinese characters
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaborating on group projects in Chinese
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing Chinese texts for meaning and context
Evaluating different perspectives on Chinese topics
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing time effectively for Chinese language study

courseDescription: The advanced study of selected topics designed to permit small groups of qualified students to work on subjects of mutual interest which, due to their specialized nature, may not be offered regularly. May be repeated for credit if the topic is different.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Participating in group discussions in Chinese
Engaging in conversational Chinese with peers
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing Chinese texts for meaning and context
Identifying grammatical structures in Chinese sentences
Solving translation challenges in Chinese language
